channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Right next to one that only got fill Tuesday, 16th May
item.description:
The bus drives over it and the vibration shakes our houses. I have complained about theses hole before. There is going to be an accident soon because cars avoid the holes and are just missing cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Ansell Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ref 5451456, 16th May
item.description:
Originally reported 16th Jan 2024. Now getting worse and we can not open our windows as every time a car goes over it it makes a racket. Please provide an immediate update of when this is going to be looked at.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Gotherington Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A few holes all together, 16th May
item.description:
As you come off the bypass and turn left right on the junction. There are a few potholes all together. Now getting very dangerous if you donâ€™t know they are there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valiant Way, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing kerb, 16th May
item.description:
There is a missing kerb in the newly resurfaced pedestrianised area between marle hill road and Wellesley road - the area was recently resurfaced as part of the cycle spine major project but this kerb is missing- it is not clear whether this is the finished job because it looks untidy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Wellington Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Golf course bridge needs a safety "kick plank" which is missing. Dogs and people could easily slip into the brook., 16th May
item.description:
This bridge is located on footpath ECN1, a few hundred metres northwest (downstream) of Halfway Bridge, the first footbridge one comes to on Normans Brook.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Sign/waymarker is damaged problem has been found, 16th May
item.description:
Footpath sign at B4063 junction with Westover Court is very rusty with a large hole and needs replacing to match the new one opposite.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 16th May
item.description:
The oncoming traffic is unable to see any cars coming out of Withybridge lane. There is going to be an accident if nothing is done!
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Sign/waymarker is misleading problem has been found, 16th May

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Series of drains that cross the road seem to have dropped, there are about 5 evenly spaced out down Station Road from Huntsmen's Meet to Waterside Close, 16th May
item.description:
Drains crossing Station Road Andoversford from Huntsmen's Meet to Waterside Close have dropped. This is causing severe vibrations to houses bordering the road when the buses and large vehicles travel down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Telent Box covered in Grafitti, 16th May
item.description:
Been covered in grafitti for months. Reported to Telent a month ago who stated they had reported it to Glos County Council. Not been actioned - please remove grafitti

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fiddlers Green Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 16th May
item.description:
Email received 15/05/2024 - copy attached. Customer states that the posts in the location are illegally erected.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees blocking visibility to traffic lights, 16th May
item.description:
As you approach the A436/A40 Frogmill Junction from Cheltenham travelling towards Northleach the fir trees on the right are growing out over the lights. All road signs are overgrown too. Trees on left need trimming right back much further down the A40 just after the bend by the petrol station so that the lights can be seen earlier. This happens every summer.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
